Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_395377: What is the best way to check internet connection in background constantly?
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_395377: #!/bash/bash
if ! [ "$(ping -c1 8.8.8.8)" ]
then
    modprobe -r rt2860
    modprobe rt2800pci
    ip link set wlan0 down
    ip link set wlan0 up
fi

Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_169900: setting mysql root password in CentOS 7
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_169900: yum remove mysql mysql-server

mv /var/lib/mysql /var/lib/mysql_old_backup

rm -vR /var/lib/mysql

mysql -u root

Explanations about Options.-u: The user name of the MySQL account to use for connecting to the server.

Top-3 Similar Questions: su_1630062: Vnc viewer error: unable connect to socket: Connection refused (111) in CentOS 8

Explanations about Options.-N: Do not execute a remote command. This is useful for just forwarding ports.
Explanations about Options.-f:
Requests ssh to go to background just before command execution. This is useful if
 ssh is going to ask for passwords or passphrases, but the user wants it in the
 background. This implies -n. The recommended way to start X11 programs at a remote
 site is with something like ssh -f host xterm.
